result.execSummary:
The defendant Penny L Bartram was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No contact with J.L. directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
Any counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Penny L Bartram

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 1:37 PM Defendant Penny L Bartram in court.  Attorney Wesley J Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: Ct 2 - Guilty.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.   Ct 1 - DRI. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 18 mos probation - Conditions: NC w/ J. L. Any counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent, Costs to include the domestic abuse surcharge w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Penny L Bartram in court.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Ryan advises Court that a resolution has been reached. P/S hearing scheduled.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Case called @ 1:07 PM Defendant Penny L Bartram appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant failed to appear for IA on March 22, 2022. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant waives her right to counsel. Bond argument by ADA Ryan. Statement by DE regarding bond. Court orders $500 Cash Bond.  NGP entered. PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.

Case called @ 2:24 PM Defendant Penny L Bartram not in court.  Attorney Wesley J Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin. Based on non appearance the Court authorizes the issuance of an arrest warrant extraditable within the State of Wisconsin. Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
